attributes.action: I want the government to recognise  severe neuropathy as a disability
attributes.background: Neuropathy is a extremely painful progressive disease. Nothing can cure it,there is only treatment for the pain.It usually starts in the feet,then hands but eventually affects the whole body

attributes.action: Dads given 10 weeks parental leave with pay for more time with their new born
attributes.background: I believe dads should be around more with there new born child, some fathers work late nights and end up having to only see the new born child while they are sleeping. 2 weeks isn't anywhere near acceptable amount of time, also having dad home longer it will be great help for the mother and bonding.

attributes.action: Fully-fund all disabled veteran British service people and their families.
attributes.background: For too long, the RBL Poppy Appeal and HFH charities subsidies care and support given to disabled returned service people and their families. Taxation is being squandered on Trident when the real cost has already been incurred. It is morally wrong to depend on charity. It's the government's duty.
attributes.additional_details:
1/ The amount spent on Trident is obscene.
2/ The shameful shortfall required to barely fund care and support currently is being topped up by charities. Without it they would be even worse off. 
3/ It's been going on for too long.
4/ The Government has all the stats. What they need is the guts and moral stamina to take care of our fallen. Fully.
5/ The Poppy has become a symbol of successive Government's failure to care for our damaged service people and their families.
6/ It's our moral duty.

attributes.action: Make a 1471 type phone service to report scam calls and block offending numbers.
attributes.background: We're all open to scam phone calls e.g. from 'Microsoft fraud dept' wanting to connect to my PC so they can 'delete a virus'. At the moment, we have to be reactive to these calls and can only spread the word on Facebook, emails etc to warn others but what if we could all help to actually stop them?
attributes.additional_details: When you get a call, you can dial 1471 to get the last callers number. I want to get the phone companies to take collective action to create an easier way to report and block scammers. My idea would be free service that, after getting a scam call, you could dial a 4 digit number, like you do with 1471. This would report the last callers as a scammer. If this number gets over a certain number of reports, it could then be blocked.

attributes.action: Use motorway matrix signs to say "Keep left unless overtaking."
attributes.background: This could be used where appropriate to remind drivers that are driving in centre lanes to move over. Thus helping traffic flow.

attributes.action: Allow HM Armed forces to be able to vote at their current base UK or worldwide.
attributes.background: Due to the busy and unpredictable nature of their jobs Service personnel have found it difficult to vote in person or by post/proxy and often don't get to have their say on matters and the things that ultimately effect their careers, families and their country they are proud to serve.

attributes.action: Ban tenant renewal fees
attributes.background: Why should we, the tenants, or even the landlords, have to pay out an extreme amount of money just for estate agents to print out the exact same paper as they did before, with just a couple of numbers changed? I SAY NO!
attributes.additional_details:
This world is hard enough you love in with all the prices on rent, bill, shopping etc, increasing all the time.
Estate agents make enough money from us.
It's extortionate for them to request more money for then to do absolutely nothing other than print out a bit of paper.
Anyone can do this.

That money being requested could go towards a lot of things you need.
DON'T let them keep doing this to you.
DON'T let them rip you off!!
Sign now, and let's fight back to take what is OURS!!

attributes.action: For ALL EU Protected Sites & Species to carry on being so even if not in the EU
attributes.background: We have various species and sites in the UK that are currently protected by EU law.  We must ensure that these continue to be protected within the UK even if we are no longer part of the European Union due to the result of the recent democratic vote.
attributes.additional_details:
A few links to various species and sites that are currently protected: 
http://jncc.defra.gov.uk/page-1747
https://www.gov.uk/topic/environmental-management/wildlife-habitat-conservation

attributes.action: Brexit negotiations to promote a strong & collaborative relationship with the EU
attributes.background: Sixteen million people voted to Remain. The views of these people and the weight of their opinion must be reflected in Brexit negotiations. The negotiation team must focus on forging a strong, collaborative and balanced working relationship with the EU, and be made up accordingly.
attributes.additional_details:
I was vehemently for Remain, and now I am determined that Brexit is made to mean healthy collaboration with the EU on new terms (and terms that the Northern Ireland and Scotland can support as part of the UK) rather than a soapbox for nationalistic rhetoric!

Britain may have voted out, but it clearly and emphatically does not want away. Most importantly, Brexit does not (and will not) mean embracing the Farage and Le Pen view of the world!

It is hope the EU will help us make this happen.

attributes.action: To review spent criminal convictions on a dbs after 10 years have elapsed.
attributes.background:
I was convicted 15 years ago of possession with intent to supply cannabis. 
I served my community service order and have never or will never re-offend.
The problem I have know is this will always show on a dbs disclosure and has stopped me, in some cases having a good career.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst I understand certain convictions should remain on a dbs disclosure permanently, my view is that a lot of people deserve a bona fide second chance. 
A wiping of the slate clean so to speak. I don't want myself and probably many others to keep on getting refused the chance to do better for themselves and their families because of a mistake they've made many years ago and have properly rehabilitated from. 
I urge the government to seriously consider this and let genuinely remorseful people move on.

attributes.action: Define rights of EU citizens currently living in Britain after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
There are many EU citizens who have been living and working in Britain for many years, and built lives here

Once Clause 50 is enacted, nothing will definite their status.
However, the British Parliament can define immediately what rights these people have once we are no longer in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Some EU citizens have lived here for decades, worked, paid taxes, and contributed to the British Economy.
No timeline has been given by Parliament to start, and it can take up to two years to complete
It is unfair to expect tax paying people to endure this period of uncertainty in their lives.  This decision does not need to wait for EU negotiations to begin, or await a new prime minister – it can be enacted with immediate effect, as this right will be the responsibility of the British People

attributes.action: Create a multi-party team to negotiate the exit from the EU including MYPs
attributes.background: The exit from the EU has a long term impact. MYPs (youth parliamentarians) should be included in a new multi party team that leads the exit rather than the leader of the largest party in Westminster. This team needs to reflect the views and background of the nation as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: There are 12 different political parties with MPs in Westminster. There are 369 MYPs. The young have the most to lose from a poorly negotiated exit. Let's ensure a democratically representative task force, including all parties and elected young people leads the exit process. This will avoid the exit being led by a team with an unrepresentative perspective on what we in the UK want. This gives us a chance at getting the democracy in the UK that we deserve.

attributes.action: We need a Government of National Unity elected by Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: Solving the EU withdrawal problems will require help from the best of politicians, regardless of their political persuasions. With Proportional Representation every vote will again count and every voter's interest will be protected.

attributes.action: European Union Referendum, 75% Required
attributes.background: Call upon HM Government to implement a rule that if the Remain or Leave vote is less than 75% then the Referendum Vote to Remain or to Leave the European Union is conducted again, until we reach 3/4 of the United Kingdom agreeing to either Remain or to Leave the European Union.

attributes.action: Not to invoke Article 50 until the year 2026.
attributes.background:
Leaving the EU because a political party used the promise of an in out referendum on our European membership as an electoral bribe was both ethically and morally wrong. 
For this, and many other reasons, I feel that a prolonged period of reflection is needed before Article 50 is invoked.

attributes.action: Give UK citizenship to all migrants living in the UK on the 23rd June 2016.
attributes.background: Let's start the UK's move to full sovereignity with a promise to migrants, both EU and otherwise,  that they will be entitled to full citizenship if they were registered as living in the UK on the 23rd of June 2016.

attributes.action: Create further protection for the UK's Human Rights Act of 1998
attributes.background: The UK's legal human rights are formed from the Human Rights Act of 1998, and was protected informally by our membership of the EU. It is now possible future governments will adapt or remove UK citizens human rights easily if no protection through a 2/3rds parliamentary majority is created.
attributes.additional_details:
The following explains how the Human Rights Act protects rights we all assume we have:

https://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/human-rights/what-are-human-rights/human-rights-act

And evidence of considerations to remove the act by members of the Government:

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/scrapping-the-human-rights-act-will-help-protect-human-rights-attorney-general-says-a6894966.html

Do not allow your rights as individuals in the UK to be lost because the UK has left the EU.

attributes.action: In future votes ballot slip to carry a warning that once cast the vote is final
attributes.background: After the Brexit vote and stories in the press that people voted out/remain as a protest and now wish to change their vote ballot slips should carry a warning that once placed in the ballot box your vote is final and can not be changed
attributes.additional_details: Also people should be made aware that in a democratic voting process when one side should win more votes than the other no matter how slim the margin the side with the most votes wins and there is no option to rerun the vote

attributes.action: Let Bristol & London remain in the EU following a majority in the referendum
attributes.background: Following on from the EU referendum, Bristol & London both had an overwhelming majority vote to remain with Bristol at 62% & London at 73.5%. They should therefore be allowed to remain in the EU governed as separate county states by local government.

attributes.action: Allow the area within the M25 to secede from the UK and remain part of the EU.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe the results of the EU referendum highlight irreconcilable differences between those living within the M25 and those outside of it.  Accordingly, we wish to secede from the UK so that we can have our (sane) vote to remain part of the EU respected.
attributes.additional_details: We invite those areas of the UK that voted to remain to join us and become part of a new commonwealth of the enlightened.

attributes.action: Create an independent City State of London & the surrounding areas.
attributes.background: Due to the recent European Referendum result, it's apparent that London has a significantly different outlook in regards to the rest of the world. We therefore wish for London to break away from the UK and become an independent, sovereign nation.

attributes.action: I would like you to ban birds that are kept in cages.
attributes.background: I would like to ban people from selling and buying birds as pets and keeping them in cages as I think it is very cruel for them to spend their lifetime in a cage and not being able to fly freely like they should do. Birds are born to fly and don't deserve a life like this...

attributes.action: No confidence in the Government's Naval Strategy
attributes.background:
The Government should increase the effectiveness of the Royal Navy by designing and building the fleet into a credible and efficient navy by reducing the colossal waste and inefficiency in defence procurement.
We need to change the Royal Navy into an effective navy that can be fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
We the undersigned via this petition wish to show our dismay with the Government’s naval strategy, caused by underfunding, resulting in new ships unfit for purpose, delays in building the Type 26 Frigate and overspends on other projects.
More money should be allocated to the naval budget by reducing the amount spent on foreign aid”

attributes.action: An electronic voting system needs bringing in.
attributes.background: By moving forward from the outdated paper-based voting system you will squash a lot of the rumours of a rigged election as many people do not trust the governing body. I know many people who do not vote because they believe that their votes are essentially changed due to having to use a pencil.
attributes.additional_details: Not only would an updated voting system be a step in the right direction but also it wood make our country look better and more fair. People may also be able to trust an electronic voting system more than the current paper-based one.

attributes.action: Sporting events involving national team/competitor
attributes.background: It is absolutely disgraceful that I as a British national should have to pay to watch my national team compete in a sporting event. All sporting events involving any national team or competitor must by law be screened on terestrial television.

attributes.action: Require all computer operating systems have up/down scroll bar arrows.
attributes.background: For the past four years the Apple operating system, Mac OS X has had no up/down arrows on it's scroll bar. This was a none optional global change, so affects all software run in Mac OS X, even if it isn't Apple software. This causes difficulties for some disabled people and none disabled people too.
attributes.additional_details:
https://discussions.apple.com/thread/3196331?tstart=0
http://www.quicken.com/support/scrollbar-arrows-missing-using-quicken-lion-os
http://reverttosaved.com/2015/02/18/access-all-areas-why-even-apple-needs-to-rethink-regarding-accessibility/
https://discussions.apple.com/message/30209946#30209946
http://www.macworld.co.uk/news/mac/opinion-whats-wrong-mountain-lion-interface-3425603/

attributes.action: Petrol stations must offer the option to purchase fuel with a CO2 offset eg +1p
attributes.background: Driving my car contributes to global warming because burning fuel produces CO2. I would happily choose to pay an extra penny or so to offset my carbon, for example, by planting a tree. We will empower every driver to make a difference and show that Britain can lead the world in CO2 reduction.
attributes.additional_details:
It is very difficult for ordinary people to reduce the amount of CO2 that they produce. I have to heat my house in winter, drive to work and I like to go on holiday somewhere warm. Although I can reduce my consumption a bit, I can't reduce it enough to make a difference on my own. However if I work with other people I can make a difference.

 "Carbon offsetting" allows me to pay other people to reduce their CO2 emissions and "offset" my own. Here are some examples of offsetting projects https://www.bptargetneutral.com/uk/our-projects/a-global-portfolio/

attributes.action: Reform faith school's religious studies to follow the National Curriculum
attributes.background:
Faith schools are mostly run like other state schools. They have to follow the national curriculum except for religious studies, where they are free to only teach about their own religion.

The exclusion of other religions does not open students to other faiths and promotes ignorance.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/types-of-school/faith-schools

attributes.action: Request postponement of  KS1 SPAG test viewable to ALL online since 28/01/16!
attributes.background: The Government accidentally placed on line the official SPAG test that your children will take in May! This has been available to view and use since Jan 28th 2016!  Some children in the country have already used this as a practice paper so will be sitting that self same test for real! Invalid test!!

attributes.action: Increase Maritime patrols / air surveillance at sea to protect the UK
attributes.background: Not enough patrol boats or air surveillance re intelligence and prevent terriosts traveling across the English Channel to gain entry into the UK.   Only five patrol boats currently. I reference 15/04/16 two Iranian men called 999 whilst floating in a small rubber boat in the sea

attributes.action: Support farmers,pay rural farm payments on time.
attributes.background: This badly organised system has caused suicide within the farming community,disrupting cash flow.
attributes.additional_details: Payment on time: farmers are the salt of the earth:why do we have to suffer, the worry of not being able to pay our debts,last minute decision to inform us: no information as to when payments will be made.Try to get any answers is impossible:

attributes.action: Minimum sentences for police officers who lie while performing their duties.
attributes.background: Police officers swear an oath to act with the highest level of integrity. They choose to put themselves up as a beacon of virtue and honesty and believe their uniform sets them apart. They are placed above other members of society and are expected to act with honesty and integrity at all times.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent petition has been drafted requesting minimum sentencing for assaulting a police officer.

A police officer dons the uniform and in their own minds view themselves as different.

They rely on this difference when making statements that they know will be given more credence than contradictory statements made by "ordinary" members of the public.

The abuse of this power should be met with the full anger of the law they perverted.

attributes.action: Let the victims decide who should next head the Westminster abuse.inquiry.
attributes.background: Someone who is trusted or members of the public should put forward respectable candidates from which the victims should choose the head of the inquiry. The main qualification required by potential candidates is integrity.
attributes.additional_details: WE MUST HAVE ANSWERS

attributes.action: Increase the number of specialist road traffic officers to reduce road deaths
attributes.background: 10,732 people died on UK roads between 2010 and 2015. In the period Jan to March 2016 alone saw a 14% increase in reported road deaths. Without the fear of detection, non-compliance of road safety rules and laws is noticeably increasing. Enforcement is no longer supporting education or engineering
attributes.additional_details:
"The level of enforcement on our roads is woefully inadequate, 
between 2010 and 2014 the UK has seen a 27% reduction in the number of specialist road traffic police on the roads (falling from 5,338 to 3,901) outside of London". Brake-the road safety charity
Without a visible police presence, road users no longer fear being caught and are increasing non-compliant and yet detection rates are falling
Between 2010-15 133,565 people were seriously injured
Motor insurers paid out £27m per day in 2015

attributes.action: BREXIT Deal then Repeal: Parliament vote on the Deal before repeal EU Accession
attributes.background: The European Communities Act 1972 of the Parliament of UK legislated for the accession to the EU, and incorporation of European Union law into UK law. Petition insists Parliament votes on the LEAVE deal, before repealing the Act of Accession, so there is continuity and legal certainty at all times
attributes.additional_details:
The EC Act of 1972 info
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Communities_Act_1972_(UK)

Parliamentary Sovereignty
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliamentary_sovereignty

attributes.action: Free sanitary products for public restrooms so homeless women can still get them
attributes.background: Homeless woman are less likely to get these products as they will have to choose between food or these products, if we had free ones in public restrooms it would help them in the long run.

attributes.action: Get the government to remove stamp duty from buy-to-let property
attributes.background: The btl mortgages have dropped 60% since April when George Osborne brought in the states on btl and 2nd homes. This is damaging the housing market and the rental market for both renters and 1st time buyers

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for food outlets to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background:
In the uk it is not a legal requirement for food outlets to display their food hygiene ratings. 
 

Many people don't know that you can check online, many people assume the government wouldn't allow somewhere to be open if they received 0-1-2 stars. 

But they are aloud to stay open.
attributes.additional_details:
Check out local places in your area. 
http://ratings.food.gov.uk

My local chicken shop received a 0..
Local Costcutter received a 1
Local Cafe received a 1
All are still open.

Major improvements required
System or checks in place to ensure that food sold or served is safe to eat, the food safety officer has confidence that standards will be maintained in future.

Cleanliness and condition of facilities and building to enable good food hygiene.

http://www.youtube.com/user/FoodStandardsAgency

attributes.action: The abuse of a redhead should be made a criminal offence as a form of racism.
attributes.background:
It's racial abuse and harrassment and works the same as being harassed for having a different colour skin or having a different god. 
It is an 'accepted' form of abuse in society which is wrong as this amount of bullying and mental abuse is dangerous for a person's insecurities or mental health.
attributes.additional_details: I am a strong believer in this being a form of racism and I will never believe it is okay for people to be tortured for being different. People get trauma treatment and counselling due to insecurities and mental illness triggered by the abuse and harassment. People can be rejected from work, friendships, relationships and school events for it. It can have a long lasting impact on those affected and even lead people to suicide.

attributes.action: Ban the release of Helium balloons
attributes.background:
Helium is a rare gas, which is becoming scarce, we allow people to release helium filled balloons for memorials/ celebrations / competitions. 
It causes major problems when the balloons deflate for wildlife and in particular aquatic animals. A number of whale deaths are recently attributed to them.
attributes.additional_details:
http://balloonsblow.org/
http://www.nabas.co.uk/about-balloons/
http://www.abc.net.au/science/surfingscientist/heliumballoons.htm
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/how-balloon-releases-harm-wildlife/
http://www.mcsuk.org/downloads/pollution/dont%20let%20go.pdf

They are becoming part of the plastic soup we dump into out oceans killing wildlife we cannot continue like this, it a simple start please sign.

attributes.action: Facilitate access and use of Automatic External Defibrillators (AED's)
attributes.background:
"In emergency medicine, the golden hour is the period following traumatic injury being sustained by a casualty, during this hour there is the highest likelihood that prompt medical treatment will prevent death."

For heart related emergency's the early use of an AED can be key for preserving life.
attributes.additional_details:
It is frustrating to know that AED technology is out there and publicly available and that many first aiders are trained in AED use.

I acknowledge and welcome this progress but it's difficult to get these two components together at the right place at the right time to make full use of the Golden Hour of patient care.

I ask parliament to vigorously consider the following:

1. Funding/grants so trained first aiders have their own AED.

2. A database of public AED's that can be added to mobile phone maps.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for stroke survivors
attributes.background: Make prescriptions free of charge on any medication for stroke survivors

attributes.action: Start a public consultation and debate about the future funding of the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in financial crisis. I believe it is now time for the electorate to be consulted for their views on how this might be resolved for the future, as successive governments appear to be struggling to find a solution.

attributes.action: Increased protection for beneficiaries under Mirror Wills following first death.
attributes.background: My father and stepmother prepared Mirror Wills whereby the estate first passed to the surviving spouse and then to my stepbrother and myself in equal shares.  After my father died my stepmother changed her Will and left everything to her own family.  I lost my family inheritance of approx £150,000
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the following changes. (1)  A  formal warning to be included in all Mirror Wills that your final wishes may not be respected should you die first.  (2) A new legal requirement than any beneficiary under a Mirror Will  subsequently disinherited must receive formal written notice for it to have effect.
My story has been featured in the National Press, television and radio and is included in the current  television series of the BBC production "Rip Off Britain"

attributes.action: Tougher law on paedophiles,prison sentences in category  of manslaughter
attributes.background: Its disturbing how a paedophile charged with 32 months imprisonment.Peterlee police say its the the worst footage they have ever seen. The judge  went beyond the sentencing guidelines . 32 months for 5,538 indecent images of children.also 95 hours of recordings. This sentence is pathetic
attributes.additional_details: http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/news/north-east-news/paedophile-jailed-possessing-worst-child-11807748

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ban packed lunches in schools and nurseries
attributes.background: Schools and nurseries in the UK have started to BAN packed lunches, some reasons for this include: Healthy eating and allergies. As parents, it should be a constitutional right to feed our own children.
attributes.additional_details:
I completely agree there should be a CLEAR packed lunch policy containing details of banned foods but to ban them all together is wrong. 

http://www.barnsleychronicle.com/article/parents-take-action-after-schools-packed-lunch-ban

http://www.spiked-online.com/newsite/article/banning-packed-lunches-a-slap-in-the-face-for-parents/15389#.V8CBAPkrKM8

attributes.action: Include the advertising ban and mandatory targets in the anti-obesity strategy.
attributes.background: We believe that the government's anti-obesity strategy does not go far enough. We want the advertising of junk food to be banned until after the watershed and for the manufacturers of junk food to have mandatory targets for sugar and fat content. We also demand that schools sell healthy lunches.
attributes.additional_details: See the Public Health England report: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/sugar-reduction-from-evidence-into-action

attributes.action: Stop the airstrikes/bombings in Syria
attributes.background: British parliament to re-vote on military action in Syria, in light of the civilian casualities this has caused. British govt to put pressure on the Syrian govt and the coalition forces to ground their airforces & stop bombarding civilian areas, schools & hospitals through indiscriminate strikes.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has been the second largest contributor to the air campaign in Iraq. In November 2015 the government suggested that the UK had carried out 8% of coalition air strikes in Iraq. 

On 7 July 2016 the MOD confirmed that the UK had conducted more than 2,800 missions, including 915 airstrikes against ISIS targets in both Iraq and more recently Syria (865 and 50 strikes respectively). It went on to state that “the RAF has not operated at this sustained operational tempo in a single theatre of conflict for a quarter of a century”.

The Government has consistently maintained that no civilian casualties in Iraq or Syria, to date, have resulted from UK air strikes. This is no longer accurate and thus the policy on offensive action needs to be revisited.

attributes.action: Independent scrutiny into Lancs Teaching Hospitals handling of A&E downgrade
attributes.background: On 13th April 2016, it was announced that A&E department would be downgraded to an Urgent Care Centre. LTH said the A&E department would reopen in August but have now confirmed it will stay closed until a review in April 2017.
attributes.additional_details: There now needs to be an independent oversight and scrutiny of the decisions and actions taken by the CEO and board of Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust. The Health Select Commitee and Department of Health need to intervene in the ongoing situation at Chorley and South Ribble A&E.  It is imperative the management of LTH is held to account for their decisions and actions around the downgrade of the A&E department in April 2016 and subsequent actions taken to reinstate A&E.

attributes.action: Reduce the six week school holidays.
attributes.background: We are now in 2016 which is a different era from times gone by.  Parents work not every parent can rely on free childcare or assistance from grandparents.  When a child is away from school for such a long time it is a detriment to any educational development.
attributes.additional_details: Children go back to school forgetting what they have learned in the previous term.  Many children are not physically active and spend the six week holidays inactive.  Childcare is very expensive children expect to do activities which unfortunately very rarely are free.  Family life is stressful due to the time scale and general cost.  Holidays abroad double.  Time with family is important but we need to look at an agenda which helps parents rather than hinders.  If the holidays are going to continue there needs to be a scheme to aid parents.
